definition: to extend (the meaning of a word, an analogy etc)/derivation

to draw (e.g. a bow)/to pull/to stretch sth/to extend/to lengthen/to involve or implicate in/to attract/to lead/to guide/to leave/to provide evidence or justification for/old unit of distance equal to 10 丈[zhang4], one-thirtieth of a km or 33.33 meters
to extend/to state/to explain/9th earthly branch: 3-5 p.m., 7th solar month (7th August-7th September), year of the Monkey/ancient Chinese compass point: 240°
old name for Shanghai 上海[Shang4 hai3]/surname Shen
extended meaning (of an expression)/derived sense

sentences.english: “Never lie” also can be extended as “Don’t mask truths.
sentences.chinese: “不要说谎”也可以引申为“不掩饰真相”。

sentences.english: Many connotations are developed on the basis of this denotation in the mediaeval times.
sentences.chinese: 中古汉语时期，由此基本义产生出许多引申义。

sentences.english: The extensional meaning of compound directional complement has its cognitive basis.
sentences.chinese: 复合趋向补语的引申意义有其认知上的理据。

sentences.english: This extends naturally to the pleasures of the imagination.
sentences.chinese: 这也就很自然引申到想象的乐趣。

sentences.english: For more details on issues and does not serve to extend the scope of discussion.
sentences.chinese: 至于更多的细节性问题和引申不作为本文的讨论范畴。

sentences.english: According to the relation of sememes, a word has both original meaning and extended meaning.
sentences.chinese: 从词义义位之间的关系看，词有本义和引申义。

sentences.english: A word's meaning is made up of both denotation and connotation.
sentences.chinese: 一个单词的含义是由表面义和引申义组成的。

sentences.english: This story gave rise to the idiom "be wholeheartedly devoted to public duty."
sentences.chinese: 人们根据这个故事引申出“克己奉公”这句成语。

sentences.english: It is generally difficult for foreigners to grasp the extended meanings of Chinese words.
sentences.chinese: 外国人一般很难掌握中国词语的引申义。

sentences.english: She extracted a completely personal meaning from what was said.
sentences.chinese: 她从所说的话里引申出一个完全是个人的意思。

sentences.english: Finally, Dayu flood control extended the basic framework for the legal administration.
sentences.chinese: 最后，以大禹治水引申法治行政的基本框架。

sentences.english: Since then, from this story come out of the ghost is said Mahogany.
sentences.chinese: 此后，从这个故事中引申出了鬼怪桃木之说。

sentences.english: Furthermore, it presents a creditability problem about theorem proof in propositional logic.
sentences.chinese: 也引申出命题逻辑定理证明的一个可信性问题。

sentences.english: It has to be a two-way street.
sentences.chinese: 一条双向道，有来有往，引申为互相忍让。

sentences.english: In a word, extended sememes are a result of the motion and changing of these sememes .
sentences.chinese: 引申义的形成实际上就是这些义素运动变化的结果。

sentences.english: The second kind of newly-coined words is formed by the extension of word meanings.
sentences.chinese: 第二种新造词主要是通过词义的引申而形成的。

definition: extended meaning (of an expression)/derived sense
original meaning/literal sense
to refer to/to be used in place of
to mean/to imply
original meaning
to give rise to/to derive/derivative/derivation
meaning of a word
to compare/to liken to/metaphor/analogy/figure of speech/figuratively
the meaning of a phonetic loan character 假借字[jia3 jie4 zi4] acquired from a similar-sounding word (e.g. 而[er2] originally meant "beard" but acquired the meaning "and")
to sum up/to summarize/to conclude from facts/induction (method of deduction in logic)
to make a general reference/to be used in a general sense
the meaning of sth/an explanation of the meaning of words or phrases/definition/an interpretation (of doctrine)/religious doctrine
to produce (from sth else)/to derive (from raw material)/derivative
to explain/to expound/to interpret/elucidation
to elucidate/to expound/to study and explain
content/meaning/connotation/implication
